text: The Clark C. Fowler House near Tompkinsville, Kentucky is an I-house which was built in 1880. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2001. It is a two-story frame, central passage plan structure, with Queen Anne influence in details of dormers and its rear porch. It was built to serve as a boardinghouse and is on a hillside overlooking the Cumberland River. It is the only surviving dwelling in the riverside community of Martinsburg. title: Clark C. Fowler House
